User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Advocacy Alley application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was last updated.

role.description: Role of the user (e.g., admin, user).

Petition.title: Petition
Petition.description: Represents a petition created by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Petition entity.

authorId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Petition) The user who created the petition.

description.description: Detailed description of the petition's purpose.

targetSignatures.description: Target number of signatures required for the petition.

category.description: Category of the petition (e.g., environmental, social).

attachmentUrl.description: URL of the supporting document or image for the petition.

visibility.description: Visibility setting of the petition (public or private).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the petition was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the petition was last updated.

Signature.title: Signature
Signature.description: Represents a user's signature on a petition.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Signature entity.

petitionId.description: Reference to Petition. (Relationship: Petition 1:N Signature) The petition being signed.

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Signature) The user who signed the petition. Can be null if signed without account.

comment.description: Optional comment provided by the signer.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the signature was recorded.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes security and scalability for the Advocacy Alley application, focusing on authorization independence and clear access patterns. It leverages path-based ownership for user-related data and a segregated structure to simplify security rules.

*   **Authorization Independence:** The structure avoids `get()` calls in security rules by denormalizing authorization data.  Petitions are stored under the `/users/{userId}/petitions/{petitionId}` path, making the `authorId` implicit in the path and accessible without needing a `get()` operation in the rules.

*   **Structural Segregation:**  User data and Petition data are stored in separate collections, each with its own security profile.

*   **Access Modeling:** Path-based ownership `/users/{userId}/petitions/{petitionId}` makes ownership clear and secure. Signatures are stored as subcollections of Petitions to clearly define their relationship.

*   **QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** The structure facilitates secure `list` operations.  Listing petitions under a user's path `/users/{userId}/petitions` only requires checking the user's authentication. Public petitions could potentially be listed in a separate, dedicated collection if that feature is expanded. However, the current design focuses on user-created petitions.

The absence of a global roles collection (`/roles_admin/{uid}`) is intentional, as the initial requirements do not explicitly call for admin roles or any role other than 'user'. If the app evolves to include global admin roles, a dedicated collection as outlined in the design principles should be added.

This structure ensures that security rules are simple, robust, and easily debuggable, minimizing complexity and potential vulnerabilities.
